newsitem.title: FRANCE: UNIP sees lower French 1996 protein pea crop.
newsitem.headline: UNIP sees lower French 1996 protein pea crop.

text.p: France should produce less protein peas in 1996, mostly because farmers planted less field peas this year, French protein pea producers predicted on Thursday.
In a note to operators, the French protein producers' federation UNIP put the national field pea crop at 2.57 million tonnes, down 180,000 tonnes from 1995.
The estimate assumes a marginal drop in yields to 4.81 tonnes per hectare from 4.86 tonnes in 1995.
But area is seen falling to 534,000 hectares from 566,000 hectares in 1995.
Yield were sharply down in drought-affected areas of eastern and central France but strong in the north, UNIP said
Production was down sharply in Brittany on the back of lower sowings.
